intro: Isotrema pseudoutriforme, commonly known as the false utricularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in wet, marshy habitats. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and often have a slightly hairy texture. Isotrema pseudoutriforme is notable for its ecological role in wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and microorganisms.
